quote_first: On August 9th, three days later, at
quote_last: , another B−29 dropped the second bomb on the industrial section of the city of Nagasaki, totally destroying 1 ½ square miles of the city, killing 39,000 persons and injuring 25,000 more.
title: The Atomic Bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki
author: The Manhattan Engineer District

quote_first: “Yes.” Perena’s firm tone brooked no argument. “It exploded at 11:07. You would have entered at
quote_last: , so that by then you would have been exactly midway between the Gates.”
title: The Shadow and Night
author: Chris Walley
